track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

primary_contest.description:
Join HourRank 17, a 60 minute contest where the fastest coder wins!

Top 10 coders win HackerRank T-shirts. Sign up now and we'll notify you before start time so you don't miss out. 
The author of this round is Sunny Aggarwal (ma5termind). The problems are tested by Dan Sagunov.
primary_contest.name: HourRank 17

model.name: The Hurdle Race
model.php_template:
<?php

$handle = fopen ("php://stdin","r");
fscanf($handle,"%d %d",$n,$k);
$height_temp = fgets($handle);
$height = explode(" ",$height_temp);
array_walk($height,'intval');
// your code goes here

?>

model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

n,k = gets.strip.split(' ')
n = n.to_i
k = k.to_i
height = gets.strip
height = height.split(' ').map(&:to_i)
# your code goes here
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    n_temp <- getLine
    let n_t = words n_temp
    let n = read $ n_t!!0 :: Int
    let k = read $ n_t!!1 :: Int
    height_temp <- getLine
    let height = map read $ words height_temp :: [Int]
    -- your code goes here

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Can you help Dan determine the minimum number of magic beverages he must drink to jump all the hurdles?
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          n_temp (read-line) 
          n_t (split n_temp #"\s+") 
          n (Integer/parseInt (n_t 0)) 
          k (Integer/parseInt (n_t 1)) 
        ]

      (
        let [
          height_temp (read-line) 
          height_t (split height_temp #"\s+") 
          height (map #(Integer/parseInt %) height_t) 
        ]
      )

    ; your code goes here
)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [N,K]} = io:fread("", "~d~d"),
    Height = read_array(N,"~d"),
    % your code goes here
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
n,k = io.read("*number", "*number", "*l")
height = {}
height_temp = io.read()
height_i = 1;
for token in string.gmatch(height_temp, "[^%s]+") do
	height[height_i] = token
	height_i = height_i + 1
end
